elements.content: A novel metal−organic framework (MOF) of Co12(BTC)8(DMF)6(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)14⊃(solvent) (1⊃(solvents), BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate) prepared by the solvothermal reaction of CoCl2 and H3BTC in dimethylformamide presents another unique and unprecedented ternary MOF in which the triangular organic spacers, square and tetrahedral secondary building units are alternately associated.
elements.clean_text: A novel metal-organic framework (MOF) of Co12(BTC)8(DMF)6(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)14⊃(solvent) (1⊃(solvents), BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate) prepared by the solvothermal reaction of CoCl2 and H3BTC in dimethylformamide presents another unique and unprecedented ternary MOF in which the triangular organic spacers, square and tetrahedral secondary building units are alternately associated.

elements.content:
An unprecedented metal−organic framework prepared by solvothermal synthesis displays a unique (3,4)-connected ternary net with (4·6·8)2(62·8)2(4·62·83)2(62·82·102) topology.

The design and synthesis of porous metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) is now of great interest due to their intriguing topology architecture and significant applications in many fields such as gas storage, ion exchange, catalysis, and magnetism. Although this material holds promising applications, it would be a big challenge for us to achieve a major advance without understanding the structural aspects of it. Thereby, the synthesis of X-ray quality crystals of coordination polymers and the succedent topology analysis become more important. The classification of structures by Wells and O’Keeffe laid the foundation for our general understanding and designing of special inorganic compounds, MOFs, as well as covalent organic frameworks (COFs). On the basis of it, a great number of MOFs are characterized by the antitype of mineral topologies, such as CdSO4, NbO, Pt3O4, pyrite, quartz, rutile, halite, and sodalite.
elements.clean_text:
An unprecedented metal-organic framework prepared by solvothermal synthesis displays a unique (3,4)-connected ternary net with (4⋅6⋅8)2(62⋅8)2(4⋅62⋅83)2(62⋅82⋅102) topology.

The design and synthesis of porous metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) is now of great interest due to their intriguing topology architecture and significant applications in many fields such as gas storage, ion exchange, catalysis, and magnetism. Although this material holds promising applications, it would be a big challenge for us to achieve a major advance without understanding the structural aspects of it. Thereby, the synthesis of X-ray quality crystals of coordination polymers and the succedent topology analysis become more important. The classification of structures by Wells and O'Keeffe laid the foundation for our general understanding and designing of special inorganic compounds, MOFs, as well as covalent organic frameworks (COFs). On the basis of it, a great number of MOFs are characterized by the antitype of mineral topologies, such as CdSO4, NbO, Pt3O4, pyrite, quartz, rutile, halite, and sodalite.

elements.content: To achieve this goal, the key factor is the choice of suitable organic ligands and metal centers; that is, to achieve the (3,4)-connected net, one of the best ways is to choose trigonal organic ligands as 3-connected nodes and metal centers with a low coordination number such as Zn, Cu, Co as 4-connected nodes. By this way, we have synthesized and characterized the first porous tfz-type net built on 3-connected BTC ligands and 4-connected Cu nodes, a dense (3,4)-connected MOF based on 3-connected BTC ligands and 4-connected Zn/Co nodes, and a dense (3,6)-connected rutile net constructed from 3-connected BTC ligands and 6-connected Co3 nodes. In the literature, among the (3,4)-connected net, the most encountered reports are on boracite, Pt3O4, twisted boracite, and C3N4. In addition, due to the arrangement of the 3,4-connected nodes and the geometry of the 4-connected nodes, several new types of 3,4-connected nets are also documented. What is more, in this field, by utilizing the one-pot molecular building block (MBB) strategy, Zaworotko and co-workers have reported three unprecedented (3,4)-connected ternary nets that contain trigonal organic spacers, square and tetrahedral secondary building unit (SBUs). It is well-known that it is easy to prepare tetrahedral nodes, but somewhat difficult for square nodes; therefore, usually we employ the paddlewheel SBU (such as Cu2(CO2)4, and Zn2(CO2)4) as square nodes. Thereby, as stated by Zaworotko, we must note that the successful preparation of USF-3, USF-4, and USF-5 has at least to do with the tendency of the coordination geometry for Zn and Cu, and at present it is still difficult to transfer this one-pot MBB method to other metals. Fortunately, via solvothermal synthesis, we have successfully extended this one-pot MBB method to cobalt metal. In the next section, we report the synthesis, structure, and thermal stability in detail.
elements.clean_text: To achieve this goal, the key factor is the choice of suitable organic ligands and metal centers; that is, to achieve the (3,4)-connected net, one of the best ways is to choose trigonal organic ligands as 3-connected nodes and metal centers with a low coordination number such as Zn, Cu, Co as 4-connected nodes. By this way, we have synthesized and characterized the first porous tfz-type net built on 3-connected BTC ligands and 4-connected Cu nodes, a dense (3,4)-connected MOF based on 3-connected BTC ligands and 4-connected Zn/Co nodes, and a dense (3,6)-connected rutile net constructed from 3-connected BTC ligands and 6-connected Co3 nodes. In the literature, among the (3,4)-connected net, the most encountered reports are on boracite, Pt3O4, twisted boracite, and C3N4. In addition, due to the arrangement of the 3,4-connected nodes and the geometry of the 4-connected nodes, several new types of 3,4-connected nets are also documented. What is more, in this field, by utilizing the one-pot molecular building block (MBB) strategy, Zaworotko and co-workers have reported three unprecedented (3,4)-connected ternary nets that contain trigonal organic spacers, square and tetrahedral secondary building unit (SBUs). It is well-known that it is easy to prepare tetrahedral nodes, but somewhat difficult for square nodes; therefore, usually we employ the paddlewheel SBU (such as Cu2(CO2)4, and Zn2(CO2)4) as square nodes. Thereby, as stated by Zaworotko, we must note that the successful preparation of USF-3, USF-4, and USF-5 has at least to do with the tendency of the coordination geometry for Zn and Cu, and at present it is still difficult to transfer this one-pot MBB method to other metals. Fortunately, via solvothermal synthesis, we have successfully extended this one-pot MBB method to cobalt metal. In the next section, we report the synthesis, structure, and thermal stability in detail.

elements.content: Via solvothermal synthesis in dimethylformamide (DMF) (10 mL), the self-assembly of CoCl2, H3BTC in the ratio of 1.5:1 yields polymer 1⊃(solvents). The purple crystals of it are not air-stable and quickly turn to be an amorphous phase, due to the loss of DMF molecules, when it is removed from the mother liquid. The element analysis (Calc. C/33.51, H/3.53, N/2.61; Found, C/33.62, H/3.61, N/2.67) suggests the formula of Co12(BTC)8(DMF)6(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)14⊃(H2O)7.5 (denoted as 1⊃(H2O)7.5 ) for the amorphous phase. Interestingly, by immersing the amorphous phase in DMF solution, after three weeks, the crystal phase of 1⊃(solvents) is formed. In comparison to the layering method used in USF-3, USF-4, and USF-5, the present one presents another one-pot MBB method upon solvothermal synthesis.
elements.clean_text: Via solvothermal synthesis in dimethylformamide (DMF) (10 mL), the self-assembly of CoCl2, H3BTC in the ratio of 1.5:1 yields polymer 1⊃(solvents). The purple crystals of it are not air-stable and quickly turn to be an amorphous phase, due to the loss of DMF molecules, when it is removed from the mother liquid. The element analysis (Calc. C/33.51, H/3.53, N/2.61; Found, C/33.62, H/3.61, N/2.67) suggests the formula of Co12(BTC)8(DMF)6(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)14⊃(H2O)7.5 (denoted as 1⊃(H2O)7.5 ) for the amorphous phase. Interestingly, by immersing the amorphous phase in DMF solution, after three weeks, the crystal phase of 1⊃(solvents) is formed. In comparison to the layering method used in USF-3, USF-4, and USF-5, the present one presents another one-pot MBB method upon solvothermal synthesis.

elements.content: The structure of 1⊃(solvents) was determined by single X-ray diffraction at 150 K (at this temperature, 1⊃(solvents) can maintain the crystal state) and 298 K (the crystal sample of 1⊃(solvents) is sealed in a glass tube with the mother liquid), both of which give the same structure but slightly reduced cell parameters and volume at 150 K. Herein, we select the single X-ray diffraction at 300 K to discuss the structure of 1⊃(solvents). Co1 is five-coordinated by five BTC oxygen atoms to give the trigonal bipyramidal geometry with a τ value of 0.59. Co2 shows the CoO6, octahedral geometry, completed by three BTC oxygen atoms, two terminal water molecules, and one terminal DMF molecule. Co3 and Co4 hold the position occupation of 0.5 and display the CoO6, octahedral geometry. For Co3, it is surrounded by four BTC oxygen atoms, one terminal water molecule, and one µ2-connected water molecule, while Co4 is ligated to two BTC oxygen atoms, two terminal water molecules, one µ2-connected water molecule, and one terminal DMF molecule. The two independent BTC ligands afford the µ4:η2:η1:η1 and µ6:η2:η2:η3 coordinated modes.
elements.clean_text: The structure of 1⊃(solvents) was determined by single X-ray diffraction at 150 K (at this temperature, 1⊃(solvents) can maintain the crystal state) and 298 K (the crystal sample of 1⊃(solvents) is sealed in a glass tube with the mother liquid), both of which give the same structure but slightly reduced cell parameters and volume at 150 K. Herein, we select the single X-ray diffraction at 300 K to discuss the structure of 1⊃(solvents). Co1 is five-coordinated by five BTC oxygen atoms to give the trigonal bipyramidal geometry with a τ value of 0.59. Co2 shows the CoO6, octahedral geometry, completed by three BTC oxygen atoms, two terminal water molecules, and one terminal DMF molecule. Co3 and Co4 hold the position occupation of 0.5 and display the CoO6, octahedral geometry. For Co3, it is surrounded by four BTC oxygen atoms, one terminal water molecule, and one µ2-connected water molecule, while Co4 is ligated to two BTC oxygen atoms, two terminal water molecules, one µ2-connected water molecule, and one terminal DMF molecule. The two independent BTC ligands afford the µ4:η2:η1:η1 and µ6:η2:η2:η3 coordinated modes.

elements.content: Co1 and Co2 atoms are bridged by two BTC carboxyl groups and one carboxylate oxygen atom to give rise to the Co2 SBU, where the Co−Co distance and Co−O−Co angle are 3.664 Å and 108.66°, respectively, while the Co3 atom connects to Co4 via one BTC carboxyl group and one µ2-H2O molecule to form another Co2 SBU which has the Co−Co distance of 3.571 Å and Co−O−Co angle of 114.11°. Afterward, each Co2 SBU connects to four BTC ligands, and each BTC ligand links to three Co2 SBUs; through such connectivity, the three-dimensional (3D) framework is constructed, as shown in Figures and . Along the c direction, the regular one-dimensional (1D) solvent channels with a dimension of 0.65 × 0.94 nm2 are observed, and the volume of the solvent-accessible channels is estimated to be 5034.7 Å3, equal to 49.3% of cell volume, by the PLATON program.
elements.clean_text: Co1 and Co2 atoms are bridged by two BTC carboxyl groups and one carboxylate oxygen atom to give rise to the Co2 SBU, where the Co-Co distance and Co-O-Co angle are 3.664 Å and 108.66°, respectively, while the Co3 atom connects to Co4 via one BTC carboxyl group and one µ2-H2O molecule to form another Co2 SBU which has the Co-Co distance of 3.571 Å and Co-O-Co angle of 114.11°. Afterward, each Co2 SBU connects to four BTC ligands, and each BTC ligand links to three Co2 SBUs; through such connectivity, the three-dimensional (3D) framework is constructed, as shown in Figures  and . Along the c direction, the regular one-dimensional (1D) solvent channels with a dimension of 0.65 × 0.94 nm2 are observed, and the volume of the solvent-accessible channels is estimated to be 5034.7 Å3, equal to 49.3% of cell volume, by the PLATON program.

elements.content: View of the (3,4)-connected net and its building blocks: the bigger balls in red and blue are coordinated water and DMF molecules.
elements.clean_text: 1  View of the (3,4)-connected net and its building blocks: the bigger balls in red and blue are coordinated water and DMF molecules.

elements.content: The geometry of the triangular organic spacers, square and tetrahedral SBUs. As discussed in the text, the key factor for the construction of (3,4)-connected ternary net is the preparation of square nodes: in USF-3, USF-4 and JLU, the paddlewheel SBU of Zn2(CO2)4, and in USF-5, the similar paddlewheel SBU of Cu2(CO2)4 is built, whereas in the present case, it possess the pseudo paddlewheel SBU of Co2(CO2)4. In the literature, such pseudopaddlewheel SBU of Co2(CO2)4 is undeveloped.
elements.clean_text: 2  The geometry of the triangular organic spacers, square and tetrahedral SBUs. As discussed in the text, the key factor for the construction of (3,4)-connected ternary net is the preparation of square nodes: in USF-3, USF-4 and JLU, the paddlewheel SBU of Zn2(CO2)4, and in USF-5, the similar paddlewheel SBU of Cu2(CO2)4 is built, whereas in the present case, it possess the pseudo paddlewheel SBU of Co2(CO2)4. In the literature, such pseudopaddlewheel SBU of Co2(CO2)4 is undeveloped.

elements.content: Better insight into this framework can be achieved by topology analysis. On the basis of the connectivity of Co2 SBU and BTC ligands, they are viewed to be 4-connected and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Interestingly, as shown in Figure , the geometry of the two Co2 SBUs is different: one formed by Co1, Co2 displays the tetrahedral geometry, whereas the other completed by Co3, Co4 has pseudosquare geometry, and their ratio is 2:1. According to Wells’ topology definition, the present one is a (3,4)-connected net with the (4·6·8)2(62·8)2(4·62·83)2(62·82·102) Schläfli symbol. (Figure ) As discussed above, the diversity of the (3,4)-connected net is because of the geometry of the 4-connected node and the arrangement of (3,4)-connected nodes. The boracite and C3N4 net is built on 4-connected tetrahedral nodes, while the Pt3O4, twisted boracite, and PtS-related net are based on square nodes. Recently, Lah reported a new (3,4)-connected net that is built on two topologically different square nodes, and Lu reported an unprecedented (3, 4)-connected jph net where the 3-connected node is connected not to three 4-connected nodes but to a 4-connected node and two 3-connected nodes. Until now, to our best of knowledge, there are only four (3,4)-connected ternary nets, viz., USF-3, USF-4, USF-5, and JLU, where USF-3 shows a 1:2 ratio for tetrahedral/square nodes, but the 2:1 ratio for tetrahedral/square nodes is observed in USF-4, USF-5, and JLU. The difference for USF-5 and JLU is the longer vertex symbols. Among these reported records, USF-4 is more complicated, as it is a topologically tetranodal net that contains two kinds of trigonal nodes with different vertex symbols (viz., 4·6·8 vs 62·8). The present one named as NKU is also a topologically tetranodal net and close to USF-4, but its vertex symbol is very different from USF-4, viz., (4·6·8)2(6·6·82)2(6·6·8·8·104·*)(4·6·6·8·8·104)2 for USF-4 vs (4·6·82)2(6·6·82)2(6·6·82·82·122·122)(4·6·6·8·8·8)2 for NKU. Thus, it is believed that NKU presents another unique and unprecedented ternary MOF built on trigonal, square, and tetrahedral nodes. The comparison of the above-mentioned (3,4)-connected net is listed in in detail.

(Figure ) As discussed above, the diversity of the (3,4)-connected net is because of the geometry of the 4-connected node and the arrangement of (3,4)-connected nodes. The boracite and C3N4 net is built on 4-connected tetrahedral nodes, while the Pt3O4, twisted boracite, and PtS-related net are based on square nodes. Recently, Lah reported a new (3,4)-connected net that is built on two topologically different square nodes, and Lu reported an unprecedented (3, 4)-connected jph net where the 3-connected node is connected not to three 4-connected nodes but to a 4-connected node and two 3-connected nodes. The present one named as NKU is also a topologically tetranodal net and close to USF-4, but its vertex symbol is very different from USF-4, viz., (4⋅6⋅8)2(6⋅6⋅82)2(6⋅6⋅8⋅8⋅104⋅*)(4⋅6⋅6⋅8⋅8⋅104)2 for USF-4 vs (4⋅6⋅82)2(6⋅6⋅82)2(6⋅6⋅82⋅82⋅122⋅122)(4⋅6⋅6⋅8⋅8⋅8)2 for NKU. Thus, it is believed that NKU presents another unique and unprecedented ternary MOF built on trigonal, square, and tetrahedral nodes. The comparison of the above-mentioned (3,4)-connected net is listed in  in detail.

elements.content: As the crystal samples of 1⊃(solvents) is not air-stable, we can only select the amorphous phase of 1⊃(H2O)7.5 to carry out the thermogravimetric analyis (TGA) (). On the basis of the formula of the amorphous phase, the first major weight loss of 26.6% at 50–270 °C is ascribed to the release of guest water molecues, coordintaed water molecules, and coordinated DMF molecules (calc. 26.7%), thus resulting in the new phase of 1′. Further, there is no weight loss until the chemical decomposition at 400 °C. The powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) studies on 1⊃(H2O)7.5 and 1′ imply their amorphous phase (). Notably, by immersing 1⊃(H2O)7.5 or 1′ in DMF solution for three weeks, such amorphous phase is turned into a crystal phase of 1⊃(solvents), which is confirmed by single crystal XRD. Moreover, the measurement of an N2 adsorption isotherm at 77 K revealed almost no N2 uptake for 1′, which suggests that the guest framework of 1⊃(solvents) cannot be maintained upon desolvation ().
elements.clean_text: As the crystal samples of 1⊃(solvents) is not air-stable, we can only select the amorphous phase of 1⊃(H2O)7.5  to carry out the thermogravimetric analyis (TGA) (). On the basis of the formula of the amorphous phase, the first major weight loss of 26.6% at 50-270 °C is ascribed to the release of guest water molecues, coordintaed water molecules, and coordinated DMF molecules (calc. 26.7%), thus resulting in the new phase of 1'. Further, there is no weight loss until the chemical decomposition at 400 °C. The powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) studies on 1⊃(H2O)7.5  and 1' imply their amorphous phase (). Notably, by immersing 1⊃(H2O)7.5  or 1' in DMF solution for three weeks, such amorphous phase is turned into a crystal phase of 1⊃(solvents), which is confirmed by single crystal XRD. Moreover, the measurement of an N2 adsorption isotherm at 77 K revealed almost no N2 uptake for 1', which suggests that the guest framework of 1⊃(solvents) cannot be maintained upon desolvation ().

elements.content: In summary, through this research, we have demonstrated that, via solvothermal synthesis, the one-pot MBB method can be extended to cobalt metal, and the resulting MOF presents another unique and unprecedented ternary MOF that is comprised of triangular organic spacers, square and tetrahedral SBUs. From a topological view, it is a tetranodal net and close to USF-4, but its vertex symbol is very different from USF-4 and other reported ternary MOFs. Moreover, notably, in the present one, we have explored a new pseudopaddlewheel SBU of Co2(CO2)4, different from the reported Cu2(CO2)4, and Zn2(CO2)4 paddlewheel SBU, which will, to some extent, enrich the one-pot MBB method and give us more chance to access exceptional MOFs built on Co-based square nodes.
elements.clean_text: In summary, through this research, we have demonstrated that, via solvothermal synthesis, the one-pot MBB method can be extended to cobalt metal, and the resulting MOF presents another unique and unprecedented ternary MOF that is comprised of triangular organic spacers, square and tetrahedral SBUs. From a topological view, it is a tetranodal net and close to USF-4, but its vertex symbol is very different from USF-4 and other reported ternary MOFs. Moreover, notably, in the present one, we have explored a new pseudopaddlewheel SBU of Co2(CO2)4, different from the reported Cu2(CO2)4, and Zn2(CO2)4 paddlewheel SBU, which will, to some extent, enrich the one-pot MBB method and give us more chance to access exceptional MOFs built on Co-based square nodes.

elements.content: Crystal data in CIF format; information on the synthesis of 1⊃(solvents), crystal data, table of compound information, TG plot, XRD data, and N2 absorption isotherms. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

metadata.title: A Ternary Metal−Organic Framework Built on Triangular Organic Spacers, Square and Tetrahedral Co2 Secondary Building Units
